{"step_by_step_thinking": "The patient is a 23-year-old primigravida with increased fatigability. The complete blood count results show an erythrocyte count of 3.9 million/mm3, Hb 11.1 g/dL, and MCV 90 fL. The HCT is 32%, which is slightly low. Reticulocyte count is 0.2%. Considering the patient's pregnancy and normal vital signs, the most likely cause of this anemia is iron deficiency due to inadequate supplementation during pregnancy.
